cultural_note: Portuguese body language is expressive - gestures important!

mnemonic: CABEÇA = ka-BE-sa - your HEAD CABinet of thoughts!
cultural_note: 'Dor de cabeça' (headache) - say this at the pharmacy!

mnemonic: OLHO = OL-yo - OWL has big eyes too!
cultural_note: 'Olhos verdes' (green eyes) are considered beautiful in Portugal!

mnemonic: NARIZ = na-RIZZ - your nose RISES from your face!
cultural_note: 'Meter o nariz' (stick your nose in) means to be nosy!

mnemonic: BOCA = BO-ka - your mouth is a BOXcah of words!
grammar_notes: Feminine. Used for eating and speaking.
cultural_note: 'Cala a boca!' (Shut up! - literally 'quiet the mouth') - rude but used!

mnemonic: ORELHA = o-REL-ya - your EAR is a shell (caracol)!
cultural_note: 'Sou todo orelhas' (I'm all ears) - same expression as English!

mnemonic: MÃO = mowng - nasal sound like MANGO without go!
cultural_note: 'Dar a mão' (give the hand) - Portuguese greet with handshake!

mnemonic: BRAÇO = BRA-so - your ARM in a BRACE!
PERNA = PER-na - your LEG makes you walk PERmanently!
cultural_note: 'Pernas para que te quero' (legs why do I want you) = run away!

mnemonic: PÉ = peh - your FOOT pays the PAY-vement!
grammar_notes: Masculine. Small word. Plural: os pés.
cultural_note: 'Ir a pé' (go on foot) - walking is common in Portuguese cities!

mnemonic: AS COSTAS = the COSTS of carrying things on your back!
cultural_note: 'Dor nas costas' (back pain) - common complaint in Portugal!

mnemonic: ESTÔMAGO = es-TO-ma-go - your STOMACH is your fuel tank!
cultural_note: 'Dor de estômago' - common after eating too much 'bacalhau'!
